title: (x) New Good Housekeeping serif headlines - H&FJ Chronicle {David, Marc O}
content:
Here is a font that Good Housekeeping is using for their headlines... they just redesigned their magazine.  
Does anyone recognize it?  
Thanks...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752im_/http:/typophile.com/files/goodhealth_5979.jpg)
author: BrooklynRob

comments.content:
Nah, it's in RGB. People using browsers that are any good (i.e. Firefox) can't see it.

I think it's that yet to be commercially released custom serif face by Hoefler & Frere-Jones that recently popped up on the board and which name I can't seem to remember right now. Anyone know what I'm talking about?
I think it starts with a 'C' and has 'o's in its name. I know, I'm not very helpful right now, sorry! :^/

Hmmm... I can see the attachment, but I'll try again.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752im_/http:/typophile.com/files/goodhealth_4672.jpg)

<cite>I think it starts with a ’C’ and has ’o’s in its name.</cite>  
 [**C** aled **o** nia?](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752/http:/www.linotype.com/1272/newcaledonia-family.html) Nah, not really. But maybe in that spirit.

Still can't see the attachment, but are you talking about H&FJ Chronicle, Yves?

[http://typophile.com/node/34023](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752/http:/typophile.com/node/34023 "http://typophile.com/node/34023")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/32911](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752/http:/typophile.com/node/32911 "http://typophile.com/node/32911")
Yesss!, H&FJ Chronicle. Recognizing the typefaces isn't the hardest part, it's remembering the friggin' names! :^P

Just got word from [Jonathan Hoefler](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jonathan%20Hoefler) -- it is indeed H&FJ Chronicle, and he told me they're going to have some big news in a few weeks. In the meanwhile check [this page](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/chronicle/index.html). ;^)

I've been wondering when this was going to be formally announced. Nestled between the paper samples and ads for stock images, there's an H&FJ ad for Chronicle in the July/August issue of Print magazine.
106 styles?! In OpenType! Yowza! I can't stop using exclamation points! Help!

mike's talkig about vincent serif used in newsweek worldwide.

knap

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752im_/http:/typophile.com/files/vincent_6049.jpg)

Finally, [H&FJ Chronicle Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100032) and [H&FJ Chronicle Deck & Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223075752/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100031) have been released.
Darn Akira, you beat me to it! :^D Yesterday night I was shown a sneak peek of the new website by Jonathan.
I love the new H&FJ site... and Didot opentype... the Harry met Sally Experience!!!
